div.span: Here's How You Can Help Survivors of Hurricane Katrina

br.br:
Working family activists continue to contribute to the AFL-CIO's special Hurricane Relief Fund of the Union Community Fund. Help us help our Gulf Coast brothers and sisters devastated by Hurricane Katrina. Be part of the largest relief effort in the nation's history by making a tax-deductible contribution now.
Please click here to make your tax-deductible contribution now.

tr.td:
Pennsylvanians for Progressive Media present - United For Progress
Listen every Sunday 4-6 pm - WHYL News Talk Radio (960 AM)
Hosted by Rick Smith and Erin Carlin from Carlisle
WHYL Call in (717) 960-0960
Sponsored by Pennsylvania AFL-CIO; Pennsylvania State Education Association (PSEA); American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees (AFSCME) Council 13; and Teamsters Local 776

div.div:
United For Progress: A Prelude
Welcome Brothers and Sisters, lovers of Freedom, Fairness, and Democracy! Together, we can unite for progress. Our strength is in our numbers - angry optimists, proactive reactionaries and all. In solidarity, we stand tall with you - our fists are raised high, our voices are loud, our walk is proud.
We work with our ploughs in the fields and we strive for the stars. We are proudly pro-union and unapologetically progressive. We believe in economic liberty. We believe in our land of opportunity. We believe that our America, our families are strongest when united. We believe in an America that respects working families and rewards their work.
The time to stand together is now. It is our responsibility to have our solutions put into action. Our solutions emanate from our values. We the people, united in progress, hold that every American deserves a fair opportunity to prosper and that every American should have access to excellent health care. We the people, united for progress, value an American government that is open, efficient, and supports equal rights – all while keeping and extending protections for consumers, investors, retirees, and our workers.
It is a pleasure to be an outlet for the Progressive Voice in South Central Pennsylvania. Please continue to support United For Progress with your phone calls and feedback, and by listening every Sunday at 4:00 PM.
Remember, as Holly Minch reminds us in the book Start Making Sense
The only mandate that came out of this election is this: Progressives must communicate their values more effectively to voters. We must talk about our goals in ways that people can hear.
Throughout history, times like these demand like-minded people to stand together and voice their opinions. All progressive-minded individuals need to unite as a cohesive unit to fight for change.
Please support United For Progress. Contact us and see how you can help today.
Erin Carlin -
Rick Smith -
